title.native: 名探偵コナン 戦慄の楽譜（フルスコア）
title.romaji: Meitantei Conan: Senritsu no Gakufu (Full Score)
title.english: Case Closed: Full Score of Fear

description:
Serial murders involving all kinds have happened. All the victims are from a Music School led by a famous pianist. Conan and company have been invited to a opening concert of the Music Hall built by the pianist. The biggest attraction of this concert is the world famous violin called "Stradivarius" and a special appearance of a singer who has perfect pitch.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Meitantei Conan Movie 12: Senritsu no Gakufu (Full Score)
Detektiv Conan: Die Partitur des Grauens
Detective Conan Movie 12: La melodia della paura

title.native: 名探偵コナンMagic File 2 ～工藤新一 謎の壁と黒ラブ事件～
名探偵コナン

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.
An art director and the representative director of Studio Ara.

[Website](https://wezard.net/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Sakai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂井泉水)

Sachiko Kamachi, known professionally as Izumi Sakai, was a female Japanese pop singer, songwriter, and member of the group Zard. As Sakai was the only member who stayed in the group while others joined and left regularly, Zard and Sakai may be referred to interchangeably. She was the best-selling female recording artist of the 1990s and has sold over 37 million copies of sales, making her one of the best-selling music artists in Japan of all time.

Sakai produced 42 singles as well as 11 albums and 5 compilations in her lifetime. In addition to "Makenaide," she produced two other singles that sold over a million copies. Six of her albums as well as her first three compilations also surpassed the one-million mark. Sakai's CD sales had been in decline since 2000, but her death triggered an increase in CD sales.

 In June 2006, she was diagnosed with cervical cancer, for which she immediately underwent treatment. She appeared to have healed, but discovered that her cancer had spread to her lungs, indicating a Stage 4 cancer. She began undergoing treatment at Keio University Hospital in April 2007 but she never fully recovered. Sakai died on May 27, 2007 due to an accidental fall at the hospital where she was undergoing chemotherapy.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](https://wezard.net/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izumi_Sakai) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/坂井泉水)

Sachiko Kamachi, known professionally as Izumi Sakai, was a female Japanese pop singer, songwriter, and member of the group Zard. As Sakai was the only member who stayed in the group while others joined and left regularly, Zard and Sakai may be referred to interchangeably. Sakai produced 42 singles as well as 11 albums and 5 compilations in her lifetime. In addition to "Makenaide," she produced two other singles that sold over a million copies. Six of her albums as well as her first three compilations also surpassed the one-million mark. Sakai's CD sales had been in decline since 2000, but her death triggered an increase in CD sales.

Sakai died on May 27, 2007 due to an accidental fall at the hospital where she was undergoing chemotherapy.

(Source: Wikipedia)

He is an animator and character designer. Motohashi started working at Studio Z. Later, after leaving Studio Z, he started together with Hirayama Satoshi and Kamegaki Hajime Studio Z5. Today he is affiliated with Xebec and is the representative director of its subsidiary Xebec M2.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

**Real Name:** Tetsurou Hamada (濱田哲郎)

[Official Website](http://t-oda.jp)

__Tetsurou Oda__ is a composer, music producer, singer and songwriter from Tokyo. Oda worked for a variety of bands since the start of his career in 1979 and was involved in anime songs on many occasions.
